relations.name: superpower_characters
relations.answer_template: <bridge> - an attribute that both characters <entity1> and <entity2> possess.

examples.description: kryptonian - an attribute that both characters Superman and Supergirl possess.
speedster - an attribute that both characters Flash and Quicksilver possess.
billionaire - an attribute that both characters Batman and Ironman possess.
blind - an attribute that both characters Daredevil and Toph Beifong possess.
telepath - an attribute that both characters Professor X and Jean Grey possess.
healing factor - an attribute that both characters Wolverine and Deadpool possess.
archer - an attribute that both characters Green Arrow and Hawkeye possess.
elemental control - an attribute that both characters Storm and Aang possess.
shape-shifter - an attribute that both characters Mystique and Martian Manhunter possess.
magic user - an attribute that both characters Doctor Strange and Zatanna possess.
super soldier - an attribute that both characters Captain America and Deathstroke possess.
genius inventor - an attribute that both characters Reed Richards and Tony Stark possess.
animal powers - an attribute that both characters Beast Boy and Vixen possess.
cosmic power - an attribute that both characters Silver Surfer and Green Lantern possess.
anti-hero - an attribute that both characters Punisher and Red Hood possess.
symbiote - an attribute that both characters Venom and Carnage possess.
time traveler - an attribute that both characters Cable and Trunks possess.
telekinesis - an attribute that both characters Scarlet Witch and Psylocke possess.
immortal - an attribute that both characters Ra's al Ghul and Vandal Savage possess.
fire control - an attribute that both characters Human Torch and Firestorm possess.
ice control - an attribute that both characters Iceman and Killer Frost possess.
martial artist - an attribute that both characters Shang-Chi and Iron Fist possess.
super strength - an attribute that both characters Hulk and Juggernaut possess.
invisibility - an attribute that both characters Susan Storm and Invisible Woman possess.
sonic scream - an attribute that both characters Black Canary and Black Bolt possess.
super strength - an attribute that both characters Superman and Homelander possess.

relations.name: sport_players
relations.answer_template: <bridge> - a sport where both <entity1> and <entity2> are known for.

cycling - a sport where both Lance Armstrong and Eddy Merckx are known for.
formula 1 - a sport where both Michael Schumacher and Lewis Hamilton are known for.

gymnastics - a sport where both Simone Biles and Nadia Comaneci are known for.

volleyball - a sport where both Karch Kiraly and Giba are known for.
surfing - a sport where both Kelly Slater and Andy Irons are known for.
wrestling - a sport where both Hulk Hogan and The Rock are known for.
table tennis - a sport where both Ma Long and Zhang Jike are known for.
chess - a sport where both Garry Kasparov and Magnus Carlsen are known for.

relations.name: architect_building
relations.answer_template: <bridge> - who was the architect of both buildings <entity1> and <entity2>.

examples.description: Frank Lloyd Wright - who was the architect of both buildings Fallingwater and Guggenheim Museum.
Zaha Hadid - who was the architect of both buildings Heydar Aliyev Center and Guangzhou Opera House.
Frank Gehry - who was the architect of both buildings Guggenheim Museum Bilbao and Walt Disney Concert Hall.
Le Corbusier - who was the architect of both buildings Unité d'Habitation and Notre Dame du Haut.
Norman Foster - who was the architect of both buildings 30 St Mary Axe (The Gherkin) and Hearst Tower.
Renzo Piano - who was the architect of both buildings The Shard and New York Times Building.
Santiago Calatrava - who was the architect of both buildings Turning Torso and Milwaukee Art Museum.
Ludwig Mies van der Rohe - who was the architect of both buildings Seagram Building and Farnsworth House.
Richard Meier - who was the architect of both buildings Getty Center and Barcelona Museum of Contemporary Art.
Jean Nouvel - who was the architect of both buildings Institut du Monde Arabe and One Central Park.
Tadao Ando - who was the architect of both buildings Church of the Light and Row House in Sumiyoshi.
Herzog & de Meuron - who was the architect of both buildings Elbphilharmonie and Allianz Arena.
Rem Koolhaas - who was the architect of both buildings CCTV Headquarters and Seattle Central Library.
Bjarke Ingels - who was the architect of both buildings 8 House and Via 57 West.
Moshe Safdie - who was the architect of both buildings Habitat 67 and Marina Bay Sands.
Daniel Libeskind - who was the architect of both buildings Jewish Museum Berlin and Denver Art Museum.
Philip Johnson - who was the architect of both buildings Glass House and AT&T Building.
Eero Saarinen - who was the architect of both buildings TWA Flight Center and Gateway Arch.
Oscar Niemeyer - who was the architect of both buildings Niterói Contemporary Art Museum and Cathedral of Brasília.
Kenzo Tange - who was the architect of both buildings Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building and St. Mary's Cathedral.

query_instruction: Given two entities, find a common link between them.
query_template: What is a common link between <entity1> and <entity2>?
